description:
Perbacco is a nice and fancy spot for Italian in FiDi. Would be great for business lunches/dinners or dates (but maybe not the first one XP).

I picked this spot for a team lunch and was able to make the reservation for our party of 8 for a noon lunch on Wed just the day before. I appreciated their flexibility as I was scrambling to find a last minute lunch spot to accommodate our larger group. Note that for larger groups, they do ask for a credit card number when you make the reservation.

Note: don't get this restaurant confused with its sister restaurant Barbacco, which is more casual and comes at a slightly lower price point. Even though I was trying to avoid making this mistake, I still somehow made reservations at Barbacco first. Whoops.

They start out the meal with small thin breadsticks, which I've never seen before. These were just okay, but I wasn't a huge fan of the long and thin shape. Also I thought they were slightly dry, even with the provided sauce.

Luckily they followed this up with some delicious bread. I'm not sure exactly what type of bread it was (our guess was focaccia), but it was very light and soft. When they came around to offer seconds of this bread, I went for it with no doubt or hesitation.

I asked our server about their most popular dishes, and according to her, the pappardelle ($24) is the most popular dish here. It comes with slow cooked short rib ragu, young onion, and horseradish sprinkled on top. It came served piping hot, and while I didn't like the wasabi flavors on top, it was otherwise a very solid and filling dish. The pappardelle was thin and didn't stick to each other, which made it easy to eat.

For dessert, we shared two orders of the amaretti panna cotta ($11), which is served with roasted roasted peach preserve, almonds, maple caramel, and peach sorbetto. It was light and creamy and provided the perfect light and sweet ending to a heavy carb meal.
author: Dianna H.

description:
Perfect for a date night! A lot classier than it's sister, Barbacco, this place didn't disappoint. They offer valet service for $12, which is not a bad price to pay for convenience in this area. We got there 30 mins early for our 8:30 pm reservation and spent time at the bar. I took 1 star away because the cocktails and the yellowfin tuna didn't blow my mind, but everything else was perfect. They also celebrated my husband's early birthday!

Yellowfin tuna - pass
Tajarin - GET THIS! If you like mushroomy awesomeness
Pappardelle - Also really good for lamb lovers
Semifreddo Al Caffe (aka chocolate cake) - we substituted the cardamom gelato for the burnt caramel gelato and would recommend it
Hazelnut cookies - nothing like anything I've ever eaten 

1 day later, I'm still thinking about the Tajarin. That's all!
author: Romeeta S.
Bob U.

description: Oh I had such a lovely, dreamy pasta. I ordered the Raviora and it was amazing. It's a fancy adult spot for sure. I didn't love the vibe, it was a bit stuffy but I guess that comes with the territory. We got a last minute reservation pretty easily on a weekend. Service was really great too. It's in FiDi and there's not a ton of stuff around it, but it made for a nice date night. I may be back if someone else pays for me...!
author: Megha M.

description:
Fantastic food and service.

Had the soup of the day a creamy corn soup with bacon chips and herbs.

My main was the fritto mist.  Tender batter fried shrimp at least 6 sumptuous pieces along with tempura type batter fried fennel, olives, free beans. 

I loved it and the service level.
author: Frank T.

description:
I've been on a roll lately. Found another bomb ass lunch spot the other day. Oh yeah!

Burrata - me no likey! lack citrus flavor. too sweet for me. Pass!

Squid - me love this long time! tender squid soaked in the right sauce with flava bean, grape tomato so flavorful, burst in your mouth. arugula on top only compliments the dish even more, gas it a earthy balance. NOTE: they peeled the skins off the grape tomato so it can really soak up the flavor and bust in your mouth, the attention to details... man! I appreciate the effort!

Best friend got the PLIN CON PISELLI - too greeeeeeeen for me, she likey likey, me no like! it's very rich, recommend to vegetarians!

I got the Pappardelle - it was good, but not exceptionally good. I mean the pasta needed 30 more seconds in the water or needed tiny bit more sauce. Just not flavorful enough :( I didnt even finish even though I came here especially for this... Bummer
author: Kris J.

description:
Highly recommend the tajarin pasta and I would definitely return for this dish alone. 

The tajarin is must if you're a mushroom fan. The pork and porcini mushroom sauce was so tasty and creamy. The pasta had just the right texture/chewiness. My fiancé ordered the pappardelle pasta which was good as well but paled in comparison to the tajarin pasta. Their roasted octopus appetizer paired well with the arugula and beans. I also enjoyed the minted southside which was refreshing and wasn't overly sweet. 

Our server was attentive and made thoughtful suggestions throughout our meal. I wouldn't hesitate to return for my next pasta craving.
author: Charlene E.

description:
*** In Short ***

Surprisingly affordable pasta that still holds up well against the upstarts.

*** In Depth ***

While I frequented Barbacco in my early years, I never got around to trying their pricier sister restaurant, always assuming it was outside my "casual" fancy eats budget. And with the recent influx of deliciously affordable pasta shops in the city, Perbacco just kept getting pushed further and further down the list.

But, having the opportunity to nab a company-sponsored meal several weeks back, Perbacco popped back up on my radar, making it the first time I took a proper look at their menu: to my surprise, their pastas averaged $20, like many other restaurants here, but with an additional choice between "smaller" and larger portions.

The other surprise came when we dug into the actual food: unlike most restaurants here, their pasta is surprisingly light. Not bland, mind you, but lighter and more flavorful than you'd expect from pasta served up in America, which often tend to be heavy-handed with butter, cream, and other seasonings. The highlights of the night were the tajarin and agnolotti, both of which I'd highly recommend.

And while they still don't topple my other picks in the city, there's definitely a time and place (and mood) for the style of pasta here, so I'm absolutely adding Perbacco into the rotation.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Spacious restaurant with plenty of accessible seating options.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Third time at Perbacco and it never disappoints. 

For starters, we ordered the roasted octopus, the black truffle burrata cheese, and the brown butter roasted carrots. It was more than we should order for two people. If I had to pick, I'd get the octopus and the carrots, since the burrata cheese is good, but not extraordinary in any way (the octopus is always great and I order it every time!) 

For the pastas, we ordered the agnolotti and the tajarin. Initially, they had accidentally served us the agnolotti with short rib instead of the one on the menu (filled with roasted meats and vegetables). We hadn't even noticed the error, but the quickly brought us the correct pasta and told us to keep the original as well since we had started eating it. 5/5 for handling the situation very gracefully and quickly without us even noticing. (Servers are well trained for details in general- every time I'd use the restroom, my napkin would be neatly folded when I'd come back- something many more high-end restaurants in SF still need to do).

We liked both the agnolottis more than the tajarin. I like thin tagliatelle but I don't think the veal and the sauce went very well with it. 

The agnolotti filled with roasted meats and vegetables was definitely our favorite pasta. 

The best part of Perbacco is definitely the desserts. We got the dark chocolate bonet along with the vanilla bean panna cotta. I can't compare the two since they're both amazing. 

The vanilla cream, the brownies and the berries help enhance every bite of the bonet, which would have been amazing on its own. My usual style is to take a little bit of the vanilla cream and the brownie with a decent chunk of chocolate bonet to have an explosion of happy tastes in your mouth. I'm already hungry writing this review now. 

The vanilla bean panna cotta is also delicious and works really well with the strawberry-rhubarb preserve and the lime sorbetto, which fills your mouth with a light, refreshing taste after the main courses. 

We were there for four hours and enjoyed it thoroughly. Will come back for a fourth time.
author: Karanveer M.

description:
Service is great. Got the veal appetizer and the burata. Which I enjoyed. The burata didn't have a strong truffle taste that I was hoping for.
For my entree, I got the paprradelle with short ribs. The pastas was cooked nicely. The horesradish was also a nice touch to help bring out the dish.
author: Teresa L.

description:
Good Italian food that's not too costly for 4 star restaurant in downtown SF.  
Octopus was grilled perfectly with beans and olive oil.  Cippino was tasty with taste of saffron, though I wish their ingredients was more bountiful.
author: David H.

description:
This was my first time at Perbacco and it won't be my last. Service was great--our server was friendly and attentive and more than happy to answer questions or offer wine suggestions. All other staff that I encountered were also very friendly and welcoming as well. 

Like everyone, I came for dinner and ordered the pappardelle and it did not disappoint. Yummy ribbons of fresh pasta layered with short rib ragu was lighter in flavor than I expected but was delicious nonetheless. I had a bite of my friend's tajarin pasta and as a mushroom lover, I will definitely order this the next time I'm here. 

The only thing that I did not enjoy was dessert. The roasted fig dessert with seasonal berries with a side of basil gelato was very disappointing. The berry juice was drizzled on what tasted like pieces of stale/dry bread. This was not easy to eat or appetizing and I'm surprised this even made it on the menu. The roasted figs were chewy and distantly resembled the fresh figs I was imagining when I ordered this dessert. Gelato and other desserts my friends ordered for themselves were really delicious however, so I'm not sure what happened with mine. Overall, I had a great meal at Perbacco and despite the disappointing dessert, I am looking forward to returning.
author: Cindy T.

description:
I came here to meet an old friend. She had a birthday earlier this month and I want to make up for it during this dinner. I asked them to put something special on the dessert we ordered, and they did! They gave us the dirty cookie as complementary to our dessert and wrote happy birthday on the plate! My friend was so surprised and we are very thankful for what Perbacco did for us.

I had the squid ink companelle Nere, which I also enjoyed a lot. The sauce was so good!
author: Xuaner Z.

description:
This is a pretty fancy place in the financial district. We went there on a business day in our tourist casuals and we saw a whole bunch of people in blazers having business lunch. I was craving for great Italian food and chose this place after looking at their menu. They started off with breadsticks which was a tad disappointing for me. A waiter was going around and was serving little slices of bread. The bread turns cold. I don't know how you can keep the bread warm unless you give it in a basket.

We got 

RAVIORA - pasta filled with meyer lemon ricotta / local summer corn / grated black truffle

PLIN CON PISELLI
pasta filled with crushed spring peas and mascarpone / roasted golden chanterelles / herb butter

We really liked the pasta. It was super flavorful though the peas could have been a little bit tender. I liked that there were a bunch of vegetarian options so that we were not left to choose the one thing on the menu we could eat.

I was *pretty* disappointed that there was no Tiramisu on the menu especially since I had been craving for one.

That said, I am glad we tried this place out.
author: Uttara A.

description: Whoops sorry, but the chicken wings picture were awesome, especially at the price of happy hour. You also get bread if you request and it's by bad either
author: Ahmed H.

description:
Ordered the agnolotti, ragu, and raviolia for two. Did not disappoint! Favorite dish was the ragu, but the raviolia with a close second. The three dishes was plenty to feed two hungry mouths. 

Also, the staff here are great! Would definitely come back again
author: Lisa L.

description:
Bring on the pasta! The accounting of my holiday season binge eating adventures cannot be complete without a review of Perbacco.  I cannot believe that I haven't written a review yet! This is a go-to date night spot because of how wonderful it is--coupled with the relative ease getting a seat without a reservation if dining after 7:30pm most nights.  If not, you can most likely get into Barbacco next door--again, with relative ease after 7:00pm-7:30pm.

Vibrant and bustling, Perbacco is always a solid bet for excellent Italian food.  You can rely on them to have the highest quality ingredients, perfectly balanced flavors, and the most delightful homemade pasta outside of an Italian mother's kitchen. I also rarely comment on the wine lists, but Perbacco has an approachable and unique selection of wines.  I find ordering wine here to be extra fun.

Service is also excellent at Perbacco.  The staff is highly trained and knowledgeable.  They are also very kind, friendly, and expert multi-taskers.

While I'd have to go back into the archives of my brain to recount all the specific dishes I have had for you, let me assure you that as a Bay Area native who has recently toured Italy for almost a month, Perbacco has Italian food that was better than a lot of places I tried in Italy.  Most recently, I had a squid ink pasta with octopus ragu and fresh seafood.  It was to die for.  Husband Bear isn't as pasta obsessed as I am, so he often gets protein centered dishes at Perbacco.  They are always excellent as well!

Overall, you can't go wrong at Perbacco!
author: Susan C.

description:
Wow. Looking for good Italian? Check this place out. 

They serve bread and butter. The butter is room temperature so you can actually spread it rather than getting it served cold and it ends up being clumpy on your bread.

The Brussels Sprouts are a great alternative to starting your meal instead of a soup or salad. The capers are a nice addition.

The Rabaton is amazing! It's a garlic-ricotta gnocchi with perfectly cooked tomatoes in a butter sauce. The pasta tastes fresh like it was made just a few hours ago. They offer two different sizes. The one pictured is the 1/2 entree. It was just the right amount for me after eating bread and sprouts.

I didn't eat any dessert but did take a look at the menu. They have an impressive cheese list, port wines and gelato.
author: Maria P.

description:
I wanted some carbs and only some good Italian pasta could satisfy me. This restaurant was on my list to try in the city for some time now, so I went in happily during their dinner service. 

Perbacco is located on California Street in the Financial District area of San Francisco. It's not hard to find. It's in between Tadich Grill and Barbacco. (Barbacco is owned by the same restaurant group. Also Italian fare.) There's plenty of parking at the Embarcadero Center parking garage or you can use their Valet parking at the front. Street parking is always an option too. 

Perbacco is on the high end spectrum of Italian cuisine. I believe their other Italian restaurant next door (Barbacco) is more on the affordable level of dining. The interior decor does match the grander level that I expected. There's a bar area by the front hostess for drinks and snacks. (I believe that they have a pretty good Happy Hour during the weekday.) The downstairs is cozy with many tables and a half open kitchen. They also have an upstairs dining area for a more intimate atmosphere. Our server was friendly and helpful. I knew the dishes I wanted so I ordered right away. In addition to the dishes we ordered, we were also given a couple of complimentary items which was appreciated. A lot of Italian restaurants don't offer complimentary bread anymore so that was a nice touch. Overall, this was a good place to go for higher quality Italian cuisine, but nothing really stood out to me out of the dishes we ordered. I would go again if I was in this area and craving Italian. I would probably try Barbacco next door also since I haven't been yet. 

Piastra Roasted Octopus : This was good. Not too chewy. The veal tongue was ok. The flavor was a bit bland though. 

Pappardelle : This was good. The pasta was al denté. The goat ragu tasted a bit too gamey for me. I'd probably try the Tajarin next time. 

Halibut "Alla Piastra" : This was good. I liked the flavor of the black olive aioli. The halibut was cooked nicely. The corona beans were really tasty and I usually don't eat beans.
author: Julie W.

description:
TL;DR Great service and some pretty good pasta

I came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. The food was great, the service was great, the company was great! We got a bunch of dishes, but the duck pasta was the best! All pasta is made fresh in house. They also have a large wine menu. Helen, our server was funny and awesome + gave us desserts on the house. We had the ugly cookies, but those ugly cookies were yummy and sweet!

Perbacco is in downtown SF, so walking/public transportation is your best bet.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Ahhhh, Perbacco, how I love thee....thank you for opening on a Sunday. Just a quick update with some photos. 

We had an early Christmas Eve meal (2:00) and wanted a little something in the evening. Our hotel was a zoo. What had started out as a nice quiet Christmas Eve when we checked in at 11:00am, quickly turned to chaos by mid afternoon.  Not a seat nor beverage were to be had. 

We took a stroll down to Perbacco. All is well.
author: Kris M.

description:
Great Italian food! My friends and I wanted to try this place in SF as recommended by a friend. Steve (manager) and staffs were excellent with service and food recommendations. 

Their pasta was amazing. What I like about their menu is there is an option for small portions for pasta which allowed us to try a variety of food. Their appetizers, squid ink pasta, and dry aged duck breast was amazing! Price is reasonable and portions are big. 

I recommend checking this place out if you are in SF!
author: Yun Chi C.

description:
Came here with my cousins for one last meal before one of them heads back home to Hawaii. 

I guess we came a bit too early because the full menu was not yet available. The hostess informed us that it was happy hour if we wanted to sit by the bar. She said they had some food available, so we figured we would go give it a go.

The hostess was not very friendly or inviting. Her demeanor made me want to turn around and eat next door, but I knew my cousin wanted to try this place. She's the one visiting, so what she want is what she gets. Our waiter on the otherhand was very friendly and attentive. He was always there when we needed him, and he often checked up on us to see if we needed refills on water or more drinks. 

The menu was VERY LIMITED. Our waiter then came to tell us that the shishito peppers were not available, so we ordered all four of the items on the menu. Everything we thought we would enjoy at least. We shared family style, so nothing became over whelming in taste.

Stuff grilled squid- Pretty good. There aren't many places that make a dish like this, so I appreciate it when I can get it. 

Chicken wings- It was okay. It was very saucy. A little bit too sweet and zesty for my liking. It was accompanied by a spicy mayo like sauce, but I felt that the wings already had enough sauce- if not too much.

Agnolotti dal plin- Very interesting. It was a bit dry on the inside. Perhaps it needed a little more sauce. 

Tajarin- I enjoyed this a little bit more than the other pasta dish. It was more flavorful all around. I liked that it was not as heavy or filling as it looked. 

Complimentary hazelnut meringue- Good! I love that it was very light in taste, a bit airy, but not too sweet. It had nuts in almost every bit. I love nuts!

I really wish we would have been able to try food from the full menu. I heard that they have really good halibut and risotto. That just means that I have to go back and give it another try! Can't say the same for my cousin, she won't be able to try it until her next visit to SF.
author: Lily T.

description:
Absolutely perfect bar like only SF does regularly. Spotless, clean, glasses all individually wiped in display, same standard applied to service bar orders for restaurant, and just the right amount of attention.
Sophisticated, tasteful, and yet pretty busy!
Excellent selection, reasonably priced.
We did not eat (only cause we so enjoyed the bar and we had a theater time), so we'll have to come back.
author: Clifford M.

description:
This is the more upscale version of the sister restaurant, Barbacco which is a few stores down. I've been to Barbacco a few times and really enjoyed everything I've tried so I was excited to try Perbacco. 

I ordered the parapadelle and brussel sprouts. The flavors in the parapdelle dish was good but the pasta was too soft and thin. So thin that I felt like I was bitting into a piece of paper. The brussel sprouts was good - the capers gave it a good kick but Barbacco makes it better (probably due to the duck fat it's cooked in). 

My co-worker ordered the sole and that looked really good and he cleaned his plate up really well. 

I enjoy my meals at Barbacco a lot more so will most likely visit that restaurant again over Perbacco.
author: Michelle T.

description: This place has it all. Great ambience, service and food. My wife and 5 year old daughter had a wonderful time. Our server made it easy for my daughter with kid portions and options. My wife and I enjoyed octopus and shrimp misto appetizers. Then we each had a pasta for a main course. We also had some great glasses of wine, including a Brunello 2008. And the house cocktails were delish, too.
author: Matt T.

description:
I actually went there for an Italian Passover dinner which was absolutely delicious!
Chef Staffan Terje collaborated with Chef Joyce Goldstein for an amazing, TRULY AMAZING feast.
Going into this I was skeptical, as I'm not Jewish and not familiar with the cuisine.
Joyce Goldstein, whom I had the pleasure of meeting while I was there, and who also signed a copy of her wonderful cookbook while I was there, outdid herself on this outstanding dining experience.
And of course, the charming and debonair owner Umberto Gibin visited our table and made sure we were pleased and satisfied.
I highly recommend Perbacco to everyone to enjoy Staffan's creations and fresh top of the line produce, fish and meat.
author: Christina P.

description:
3.5 stars rounding to 4.

I have a lot of favorite foods, but Italian is pretty up there :0) Came here on Saturday for an early dinner and left within an hour, haha! This place is WAY bigger than it looks from the outside. Loved the ambiance.

Ordered:
x PIASTRA ROASTED OCTOPUS (amorosa potatoes / fennel / poached veal tongue / ajioli verde) - I need to order octopus everywhere I go so getting this was a no-brainer. I enjoyed this dish, but it wasn't the BEST. I tried tongue for the first time which was exciting :) All the flavor complimented each other. I'd order it again.
x BLACK TRUFFLE BURRATA CHEESE (roasted hen of the wood mushrooms / shaved carrots) - Super creamy burrata with yummy greens. Nothing spectacular, but again, good.
x RAVIORA (pasta filled with meyer lemon ricotta / sunchokes / hazelnut-lemon brown butter)- Really enjoyed the lemon flavor in this. Pasta was a little too thick for my liking, but I'd order it again.
x PAPPARDELLE (wide pasta ribbons / slow cooked short rib ragu / young onion / grated horseradish) - I've been dying to try some amazing pappardelle, unfortunately, this wasn't amazing. All the pasta stuck together and there just wasn't enough sauce. 

Everything was decent, but nothing extraordinary. I wouldn't call this authentic Italian food :P Just a nice, upscale feel restaurant. 

P.S. the breadsticks are so bland!!!!
author: Anna M.

description:
This was our first visit to "Perbacco"
Made reservations for 8:00 on a Monday evening, arriving early we were seated immediately in a PERFECT table for two.
Scallops were great , four large ones.
Pappardella was very good....
"Mamma Mia" cocktail fabulous 
Big pour on "Crown Royal"...
We would go back
Great "Vibe"...
author: Judy K.

description:
Came here for an anniversary dinner and loved the food. This place is super romantic with great service, quality food at a reasonable price, and is usually pretty full. The hostess greeted us with a kind anniversary card and showed us to a lovely table.

Food was 10/10. Agnolotti is their specialty - order it (it is veal and vegetables stuffed in a handmade pasta). LOVED the Tajarin with smoked pork. Delectable!  Also as a side we loved the snap peas with meyer lemon and mint.

For dessert, the lemon crostata was exceptional. So many layers of flavor from the lemon to the earl gray gelato to the pistachios, just wonderful. 

Highly recommend this place after being in the Bay Area for an entire summer!
author: Sela B.

description: I booked the Barolo Room for 15 people for my husband's 40th. Everything from the coordination with the private event director (Stephen) to the service to the AMAZING food was great. We felt very taken care of and the guests were talking about the food days later (burrata, scallops, duck, filet, strawberry tart...). I can't wait to go back!
author: Cathy S.

description: Great food and Service was friendly and very attentive. The beef cheeks was so delicious and supper tender. I didn't even have to use a knife to eat it . It just melts in your mouth. The pasta was also good. And they have a great wine list selection. A must for fine dinning and great food. The restaurant is very modern decor.
author: Andrew M.

description:
One of my friends recommended this place for dinner before seeing Aladdin and yay, it was a hit! Very classy restaurant, so don't dress too casual. Luckily, we were dressed up already for the show, so we were good lol. Despite our waitress giving me a hard time for my ID, the rest of the dining experience was good. We ordered a bottle of wine - a 2010 Colpetrone and it was amazing. Other dishes our table got included:

-Wolfe Ranch Quail
-Riccia Nera aka Squid Ink Pasta
-Dry Aged Liberty Farm Duck Breast
-Gnocchi Di Zucca

If you have a big enough group, I recommend ordering different plates and sharing tapas style so you can taste a little bit of everything from the menu. I loved how allergy friendly this place is too. The original dish I wanted had dairy so the chef was able to modify the sauce completely! Definitely consider this place for special occasions.
author: Marissa C.

description: This place is fantastic m.  The food is always great and the service is fabulous.  I have been coming here every time I visited San Fransisco and it has not disappointed.  I have enjoyed the great pasta dishes and the fabulous antipasti menu. Service is great and a perfect wine selection.  They do not rush the meal and let enjoy your pattern/s company.
author: Pedro R.

description:
One of my fave bougier pasta places in SF. Really enjoyed the truffle week menu :)

The pappardelle, the tajarin, and the short rib ravioli were all amazing. The scallop was nicely tender, and the duck was done very well. Back when I was doing Meatless Mondays, they were very accommodating and whipped up a lovely mushroom risotto. Desserts are super solid - we enjoyed the brown butter cake, but I thought the cocoa nibs detracted from the dish.

Everything is executed well and tastes great. Good bar with big ice cubes.
author: Eva W.

description:
Healthy portions, reasonable pricing, a fantastic ambience, and to top it all off... the best handmade stuffed pasta I've ever had. 

We came on the Friday to kickoff Memorial Day weekend, and the place was surprisingly not packed (FiDi workers leaving town I suppose). We were quickly seated at a booth and our hostess struck up conversation while we waited beforehand. 

The inside of the restaurant is spacious and doesn't feel like you're jam packed with the other tables. It's always nice when San Francisco restaurants actually let you hear the person across from you, and somehow maintain reasonable prices.

Our waiter gave some great recommendations, and overall provided phenomenal service. They brought some interesting pocky-like crackers with salsa to start, then bread and butter to follow (complimentary of course). 

I ordered the Agnolotti and my lady ordered the gnocchi. The gnocchi was good, but the Agnolotti was absolutely outstanding. Far and above the best stuffed pasta I've ever had.

Basically, it's a three dimensional triangle stuffed with a delicious mix of pork, quail, rabbit, and veal that is bursting with flavor. Typically stuffed pastas have weak portions, but this plate was literally filled with little stuffed dumplings. 

The pasta is decadent, with the overflow juice from the meat stuffing serves as the sauce for the dish. The handmade pasta gives it a slightly al dente bite which creates a phenomenal texture. 

All this for a $22-23 price tag for an entree? Pretty unreal if you ask me.
author: Armand F.

description: The food here was so-so. I bit overpriced. The service was top notch though. The Halibut was good. The ravioli was fair.
author: Isaac Z.

description:
3.5 Stars

Dinner for two without reservation that night seem to workout perfectly. 

We ordered the following:

- Pesce crudo $16 = citrus cured salmon with avocado, blood orange, and hearts of palm.

- Pappardelle $17 = wide pasta ribbons with slow cooked short rib.

- Lobster risotto $17 = small amount of lobster and parmigiano reggiano.

The service was good and very attentive. However, the food was okay, but not great. Everything we ordered didn't "wow" us, rather kind of underwhelmed.
author: Owie N.

description:
AMAZING food! AMAZING service. We shared the Carne Cruda, which was so good, and the Pappardelle, which may have been my favorite thing we got. We also each got a Secondi, the scallops melted in your mouth and the Capicollo Arrosto could be cut with a butter knife. 

My only suggestion for the restaurant: serve your bread warm and your butter at room temp! Nothing more disappointing than not warmed bread and cold butter.
author: Kendall B.

description:
Perbacco was close to where we were staying during our last quick trip to San Francisco, so we decided to make reservations for dinner. There are a lot of great places to eat in San Francisco and I'm glad we found Perbacco!

The ambiance and food are on point. I had the pappardelle pasta with short rib ragu, and my husband had the rigatoni with duck. On the side, a roasted butternut squash. 

Everything was delicious. The pastas were good, and both of the sauces were meaty and hearty. Definitely a heavy meal so go hungry!

I'd definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great dinner in the city!
author: Miko S.

description:
Dinner for 2.  Nice upscale restaurant.  Had a couple of cocktails: Financial Policy and Perbacco.  Solid! 

Ordered still water, was served sparkling and charged $9.50.  Removing 1 star. 

Ordered a Shrimp and asparagus appetizer.  It was awesome.  Tried the Tajarin, and the risotto.  Risotto not recommended bland and saltless.  Removing 1 star.  

Couple of glasses of red wine recommended by the server.  Ok, bit dry.  Ended with Panna Cota - no qualms.
author: P S.

description:
My go-to restaurant for business lunches, especially with larger groups. 1:1s too, without question.

Why, you ask? Modern, sleek, upscale ambiance, excellent service, conveniently located (next to Montgomery BART station), takes reservations through Opentable or by phone. And most importantly DELICIOUS HANDMADE PASTA from the Piedmont region. 

Recommendations for the table? While they have beautiful land and sea dishes, I veer pasta 100% here:
-- Agnolotti del plin (meat filled pasta, like a ravioli, but shaped differently, literally meaning "pinch" in the regional Piedmont dialect. It won't win any awards for prettiest presentation, but I'd write home about the taste)
-- Parpadelle (wide pasta ribbons, slow cooked short rib ragu, mmmmm) 
-- a bottle of Nebbiolo (a grape varietal predominantly found in the Piedmont region) because pairing food and wine from the same region makes me smile ear to ear

Make a reservation, your manager will thank me (and you).
author: Deanna C.

description: What a great meal! Such an excellent Italian food.The service was top-notch thank you Steve ( Director of Hospitality) and company was A+ All pasta is made fresh in house. Extensive wine list. Bottom line everything is executed well and tastes and tastes great!
author: Katie E.

description: It was lovely. Got in right at our reservation time, beautiful space, crowded, but great intimate table upstairs. Server was excellent. Food was timed perfectly with enough time to get each new glass of wine before each course. Everything was tasty, my halibut cooked perfectly and my date's duck was incredible. It was a great experience.
author: Candace V.

description:
I couldn't be any happier with choosing Perbacco to celebrate a special birthday. After considering several other restaurants, I choose to hold a dinner party for twelve close friends and family. 

- Making the reservation was smooth and responsive to questions
- Food was delicious. We choose several appetizers and pastas to share, family-style for the first and second courses. And for the entrees, each person selected their own dish.  Especially enjoyed were the piastra roasted octopus, raviora, risotto, sea bass, dry aged liberty farm dusk breast, and the pork.
- For dessert, we had "ugly but good" piemontese hazelnut cookies and burnt caramel gelato. All shared since we were stuffed already.
- Service provided by Annalisa and team was superb. 

My guests were saying how much they enjoyed the evening during the event, and were doing so even days afterward.  

We've dined many times at the more casual Barbacco, and will add Perbacco to our favorite SF spots to dine.
author: Karrot L.

description: The food is fine but the ambiance and servers were better.  I work a block away and came here for the first time last week.  I enjoyed it.  Will be returning.
author: Nanette D.

description:
On a whim we came in here for dinner before we saw a comedy show up the street at the Punchline.

We walked in and were asked if we had a reservation. No we didn't, but there was one open table near the bar so we took advantage of it.

Our waiter was so amazing.  He was funny and friendly and gave great recommendations.

I started with the Pantera Rosa cocktail.  It was excellent. I had two it was so good.

The Beef Tartare was superb.  They have this pesto and bread they give when you sit down.  Let me tell you their pesto is delicious.  We also had the Duck.  Duck is always one of my favorite things to order and I was not let down on this one.

But to the best thing Ive eaten of the night was the Octopus.  It was grilled and so unbelievable to eat that I wished I ordered 6 orders of it.  The best Octopus in the world hands down.

I only wished that I come to SF more often so I could come here more often.  Everything was exceptional to the cocktails, to the food and the service.  I stand by this place 100%.  Loved every second of it.
author: Ivy R.

description:
Mehhhhhh. Won't be back. Three stars only because the service was good. The food was definitely lacking, though. 

Ordered the potato gnocchi, pappardelle, and some asparagus/cheese appetizer. 

Best was gnocchi, but even that was pretty standard. The pappardelle was so mediocre :( it was salty and the the soy sauce like flavor to it was too over powering for the dish. Mind you- Italian is my favorite and I usually LOVE pappardelle dishes. The noodle was slightly hard as well. 

At the end of the meal, both my boyfriend and I kind of looked at each other like "ehhhh =\". The ambience was really romantic.. dimly lit environment and good service. Aside from that, the food was nothin special.
author: Katherine S.

description: This is a great place for dinner. Delicious pasta. The squid ink pasta is a must try (with lobster jus... to die for). Ordered tons of appetizers, two pastas, risotto, the duck breast, and beef short ribs to share. Five of us were completely stuffed afterwards. Treated a friend for her birthday. Split the bill four-ways and it came out to less than $100 per person after tax and tip. Not bad, consider a meal at Michael Mina on the same block would have been more than $100 with tax and tip. Would definitely come back.
author: Edward N.

description: I had the beef cheek. It was tender but not very flavorful.  The peas had some hard bits. Sadly I didn't love it. Could be just my tastes and expectations.  Service was excellent.
author: William L.

description: Based on other yelp reviews and pictures I decided the pasta looked amazing here and needed to try! Was definitely not disappointed. I got the squid Ink pasta and my boyfriend got the tagliatelle with short rib ragu. Both were delicious! And super filling! They give you bread with your pasta dish too to soak up all the goodness! Service was great and it was busy! My only thing was how tight our seating was but I not out of ordinary that some restaurants do. Great time! Will be back again!
author: Melissa Z.

description: Great atmosphere and very fast service. Food showed up in 5 minutes. Portions are small and only hit on one of the two dishes we ordered. Would go again now that I know what's good. Recommend.
author: Mishkat L.

description:
Food:

Carpaccio - a good dish but it was pretty standard to others I've had before.

Duck - it was slightly on the tougher side from what I liked.  Not too bad but not mind blowing.  

Kaffir Lime Panna Cotta - this was interesting but definitely a had a grassy taste which I didn't really care for.

Service: very attentive and friendly waitstaff.

Ambiance: this is a little more formal in terms of the setting.  A lot of business people it seems come here.

Overall:  I wasn't too impressed with the food unfortunately.  Also given the ambiance I'd opt for something more casual such as their sister restaurant barbacco.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
Really loved the food here. Stumbled in and spent more than we wanted but it was worth it. Really nice evening out for a special occasion.

The heirloom tomato and watermelon salad was delightful and perfect compliment to heavy mushroom soup. We also tried the cannelloni made from polenta, which was really innovative but maybe less flavorful than it could have been.

Absolutely LOVED the Greco wine... it's a unique wine selection that has a slightly salty or oceanic aftertaste - ie it's like the wine version of Islay scotch.

The frangipane tart for dessert was really the standout. Amazing. We also tried the lemon verbena panna Cotta but it wasn't as nearly as good as the frangipane.
author: Jaclyn B.

description:
Excellent place, great food, good ambiance, wonderful service. Started with the black truffles Buratta and frito misto, both great choices but that kinda filled us up. Then ordered the scallops, oh so good. Cd not finish so brought it home, loved it. 
And the dark chocolate bones to top it off. It was just phenomenal!! A must go!!
author: Vicky S.

description: We were on a trip to Napa/SF for our 10th anniversary and decided on Perbacco as our celebratory dinner for our last night. It was PHENOMENAL. We weren't dressed as nice as we normally would be for a nice night out but we were still treated wonderfully. They even took the time to write us a nice handwritten anniversary card. Our server wasn't the most personable but he was a great server and overall the service was amazing. We had the Burrata for an appetizer- super yum with the fresh herbs. We order two past dishes- the pappardelle and the rabaton and both were wonderful. The pappardelle is probably one of the best pasta dishes I have ever had! We also shared the Brussel sprouts (delish) and had the Panna Cotta for dessert. They even took the time to write happy anniversary on the plate. Definitely choose Perbacco for a great date night!
author: Jen M.

description: As advertised! A true dining experience. Service is spot on, very knowledgeable and friendly staff. We ordered a variety of dishes- 2 pastas ( gnocchi was by far the best)- carrots are fantastic! I prefer the Brussels sprouts crispy however the flavor was excellent. This is a true fine dining experience but yet a semi casual atmosphere- great spot!!! Oh by the way the desserts are out of this world!!!!! Salted caramel gelato will blow your mind
author: Kenny P.

description:
Great upscale spot for Italian in Financial District! Came with a friend on a Saturday night with an 8pm reservation.  Even at that hour, it was pretty busy.

Servers were very attentive, frequently checking in to make sure we were enjoying our meal, had water or wine in our glasses, or if we wanted a piece of bread.  Breadsticks with pesto are complimentary and rolls are available upon request.  

Based on other reviews and recommendations, my friend and I shared the following:
- PIASTRA ROASTED OCTOPUS- olive oil potatoes were divine and the salsa cruda added a refreshing taste to the dish.  Was kinda sad that the octopus was slightly overcooked and therefore a bit tough to chew, because the flavors were excellent.
- AGNOLOTTI DAL PLIN- apparently when you come here, you need to order the pasta.  The agnolotti was the first recommendation followed by the pappardelle, so we went with agnolotti.  The meat and cabbage filling made the agnolotti very savory and surprisingly filling but delicious!  Hands down our favorite course of the evening!  Note that all pasta dishes come in two sizes- we went with the larger portion but honestly I think we might have been alright with the smaller one, given how rich this dish was.
- BEEF SHORT RIB BRAISED WITH RED WINE- very tender (that it was easy to pull apart), not too fatty, and packed with lot of bold rich flavors.  Vegetables well cooked and the light sunchoke passatina provided a light contrast with the heavy short rib.  Thankfully the portion wasn't too big- I think I could have eaten it alone if it was the only thing I ordered.
- SPUMONI- highly recommended by the waiter and a great choice.  The mousse was smooth and creamy, but not too sweet or heavy on the tongue, with the toasted pistachio butter and candied strawberries providing a bit of texture to the dish.  Strawberry sorbet gave the dish an extra sweetness and acidity.  

All together, along with a bottle of wine, down the middle it cost little more than $80 (probably far less without the wine).

Solid spot in FiDi if you want classy Italian food.  Think it would be great for work lunches/ dinners.  Definitely recommend family style so you can taste a little of everything, and ordering a pasta is a must!  Too bad one of the dishes we had was ho-hum, but otherwise I'd be happy to come back!
author: Audrey H.

description: Had a great 21st birthday dinner.  Delicious food & superior service.  Definitely will go back!
author: kate l.

description:
Summary: tasty and expensive 

Expanded: sheik interior, clean minimalistic presentation. Went with the Papardelle (dairy free!!). Excellent al dente presentation. Short rib ragú sauce was rich and flavorful. Clean presentation, good portions. 

Expensive. Parking in the area can be very challenging. Good for business lunches, dinners, or date night
author: Anthony N.

description:
Damn, this ranks as one of the best Italian dinners I have ever had.
The interior--while slightly stuffy and busy--makes for a great romantic date spot.  Service is attentive but also understanding enough to let you have some private time without constant hovering. Our waiter was exceptionally nice and gave great wine and dessert recommendations. 
You start off with a snack of breadsticks with a green dip that resembled pesto but tasted like something other than basil. It was delicious anyway.  
I got the pappardelle with short rib ragu and my boyfriend got the langaroli. Both were awesome. The pappardelle was perfectly cooked with generous chunks of meat. The langaroli is kind of like a ravioli and is filled with short rib as well but the texture is more grainy, like the meat was ground up and mixed with other stuff. Also, bread is available upon request. It's served with good quality butter as well.  For dessert we shared a crostatina, which is like a little tart. It had sesame custard and was topped with a berry jam. Tasted a lot like an elevated pb&j--yum!!
Overall I'm a huge fan of this place. It's definitely on the fancy side but not restrictively so. I'd come again for a date or another special occasion.
author: Amy X.

description:
Superb weekday lunch - look forward to trying for dinner.  Staff was excellent, friendly and helpful while professional.  Sleek space.  

But the real story is the food.  Veal tonnato (not a dish you see that often) was extraordinary, and, to be blunt, the reason I walked in when I saw it on a menu.  Followed with their signature pasta - "tajarin" - hand cut tagliatelle with a slow cooked pork and porcini ragu.  Worth licking the plate!  Finished with toasted salty caramel gelato with delightful pignoli cookies (like my mama makes at Christmas!).  

Highly recommend.
author: Joe G.

description: This place was glorious. The dessert nicknamed "ugly but good" is delish! It tastes like smashed cotton candy and fizz pop candy, and the ricotta cheesecake was super soft and the pear taste made it all come together! Obsessed! Pasta dishes were homemade and the service was also a 5 Star! We were a little late and they were very accommodating.
author: Erin H.

description:
They were able to accommodate a last minute lunch reservation for a large group. The atmosphere is upscale and the service is attentive.

For appetizers we shared the burrata cheese ($16), local mozzarella ($15), and squid ($14) which were all good. For my main dish I got the coujette ($21) which was gnocchi in a marinara type sauce with cheese. It was tasty but I thought the standout dish which someone in my group got was the langaroli which was folded pasta with short rib and black truffle butter. The truffle flavor was really strong. I loved it!

Overall nice Italian place to celebrate a special occasion and great for large groups.
author: Linda X.

description:
I had dinner here on a Thursday evening with 2 coworkers; we had 8:30 pm reservations. When we arrived they weren't ready for us and we did wind up having to wait awhile to be seated. There was a bar, some high top seating, and some booths near the front entrance; while we were waiting for a table to open up in the main dining room, the hostess informed us that if we were willing to settle for the booth closest to the door/hostess station, we could be seated immediately. As it was rainy and cold that night, we passed on this and waited for a table in the main dining room. 

After we were seated, we got the burrata appetizer, which came with pomegranate seeds and sweet potato. The pomegranate seeds and sweet potato were nice, but I wished there had been more actual burrata, since I feel like between the 3 of us we each barely got more than a bite. For an entrée I got the agnolotti dal plin, since I was in the mood for pasta but still wanted meat (I think there were a lot more pasta dishes without meat, which would be good for vegetarian diners); it was a bit too salty for me. My coworkers got the coujette (which I almost ordered and wished I had ordered, since it looked amazing) and the duck breast. Both of them seemed to enjoy their orders.

There were complimentary breadsticks with pesto sauce. There was also bread, which I believe was complimentary but available upon request; it was warm and delicious, so I would definitely recommend asking. I was surprised that I didn't see tiramisu on the dessert menu, although there were some cool looking gelato flavors (we didn't stay for dessert). Service was good and the meal was filling enough, but in the end I just didn't really enjoy the food I ordered. If I ever come back, I'd like to try the coujette.
author: Connie L.

description:
Perbacco really made my birthday feel so special. They had a birthday card waiting for me at the table. They took care of the balloons that my friend had waiting for me when I walked in and took care of the cake she brought as well. They even gave me a special birthday dessert! Such a nice touch! Service was great! She was very attentive and super nice!!
Food wise we ordered:
Fritto Misto
Carne Cruda
Little Gem salad
Pappardelle
Gnocchi
and a fish item, forgot the name, oops.
Side of brussel sprouts 
Everything was really good. The sauces on both pastas were flavorful. The pasta dishes aren't huge but everything is very filling.
author: Nari M.

description: I came here once and ordered the Langaroli, and I haven't stopped dreaming about it since. I never knew other kinds of stuffed pastas besides ravioli even existed until now! If you come to Perbacco the Langaroli is a MUST. The black truffle sauce and the braised rib filling is pure perfection. My coworker ordered the pappardelle which looked delicious as well. I may just have to come back and try every pasta on the menu...
author: Alice S.

description:
Went there for date night and had a 9p Saturday reservation. Walked in at 855 and was seated immediately. Way cool. Nice yellowfin tuna appetizer followed by delicious scallops and a to-die-for braised short rib dish. Side of brussel sprouts and fingerling potatoes sealed dinner. Desert options werent the best - could have used more chocolate!

Service was top notch. Only complaint: table of 3 men and 1 woman was obnoxiously loud. Expected our waitress to say something to them but she laughed along with them! F bombs, C bombs, generally talking at higher than expected volumes and nothing was done. That tarnished a generally great experience. I like a good time but not at the expense of other guests.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Had dinner reservations for our friends birthday got there a little early . They didn't just accommodate us and sit us early the management staff was amazing . He was very gracious and let us know it would be only a little wait.
The food was amazing we enjoyed everything we ordered.
Our server was little off as we did notice we had to remind him several times of requests we made otherwise we had an amazing evening at Perbacco!! 

Thank you !
author: Stori M.

description: We had the strawberry salad, which was different but very good.   The gnocchi and papperdalle were both wonderful.   We both enjoyed this restaurant very much.
author: Jess K.

description: Food was delicious. Service wasn't as great. Ordered the brussel sprouts and they didn't bring them to us until after our dinner plates were cleared. Server made it sound like it was our fault and wasn't very friendly with us.
author: Hillary J.

description: I hustled to arrive on time for my 8:30pm reservation and was told by the hostess my table wasn't ready because I was early. It was 8:29pm.  It's not their fault the table wasn't ready, it was mine.  We had to sit at the bar for 20 minutes. Our waiter was angry when we weren't ready at the same time to order.   He continued to treat us with barely disguised distain throughout the meal. We had to work hard to ignore this to enjoy our evening.  The food was delicious.
author: Cindy M.

description:
Everything we had here was good. 

- Scallop crudo = 3/5 stars. Lowlight of the night
- Gnocchi = 4/5 stars and pairs well with the next item
- Sunchokes = 4/5 stars
- Pear 3 ways with Gorgonzola = 3.8/5 the blue cheese is high quality. The uncooked pear was so-so.
- 20 Rows cabernet = 5/5 for the price, it's so versatile. Went well with everything. 
- Service = 5/5 Our server was top notch and on top of his game even though he was busy and didn't bring our water and bread for a long while...
- Table bread roll = 2.5/5 these plain cold rolls really don't belong in a restaurant of the level.
author: John H.

description: Excellent service. Friendly and knowledgeable. The food was fantastic. Nice large portions. I would definitely go back! Classy but not to the point where you couldn't go casual. Perfect balance all around.
author: j s.

description:
I have been Perbacco for happy hours and dinner and have enjoyed it on most occasions! I have tried a lot of their appetizers and personally think the Salumi platter is only good for big groups, if you aren't in a big group I suggest the fritto misto (basically a calamari but with hella vegetables breaded). The rest of the appetizers seem more like sides or are priced more like main courses! 

Last time I was here, I loved the Short rib ragu last time, but it wasn't there any more as the menu changes seasonly - but they always have a few short rib dishes. Here's what I tried this time (only short rib dishes): 
-Pan Seered Beef Loin and Braised Short Rib: Short rib was an after thought, but beef loin was very flavorful.  
-Plin Al Brasato (short rib pasta): If you like short rib, I would order this pasta if you like your pasta filled with a different kind of protein. Short rib with pasta is a very interesting combo, but the soft with the slightly meaty texture is a great pairing!

When it comes to their COCKTAILS, I will divide it between these categories ($12 a piece):
The STRONG/LETS GET TURNT DRINKS: 
-Nord & Sud: Kind of like an old fashioned, but heavy on bitters. Good for your money. 
-Hemmingwaywish: RUM RUM AND RUM. Oh baby, you'll light a fire under your ass (in a good way) with this one. 

A weekday drink (get you through the week, but not too wastey): 
-Midnight Dream - tequila and chartreuse is a perfect strong yet sweet combo! (Personal fave)
-Strega Chinita - vermouth and applejack - strong after taste, but great aroma! 

Biatch drinks yet yummy: 
-Perbacco - Um where is the alcohol in this? I love hangar vodka, but honestly couldn't tell! 
-Don't Forget the Flower - basically a sangria. A big portion too. 
-Strawberry Fields - Seriously can sip a whole pitcher of this. So refreshing and not too strong! The rhubarb has a great hint to it! 

Verdict: Perbacco has such a great cleanly/modern interior, yet it isn't too loud like other Fi Di joints. The servers are really nice and they are very knowledgable about the cocktails!I highly suggest getting a drink or two and trying their dinner service, but if you can't there's also Barbacco next door!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: This place was as disappointing as a sad outlet mall.  The booths were tiny (don't even try sitting in one if you are pregnant) and the food was uninspired and overpriced.  Our waitress had no pulse and a runny nose.  Also, how can you ruin burrata?  I am pretty sure the chefs never taste anything before it leaves the kitchen.  Every dish was over salted, one was super fishy, and the last had pasta so undercooked that it was crunchy.
author: Clara M.

description:
I am a very high maintenance patron right now. I'm right towards the end of a Whole30 (an elimination diet where you eat lots of meat, eggs, seafood, veggies, fruits and natural fats - but no dairy, gluten, soy, legumes, added sugar, alcohol, etc.) Eating out can often be a nightmare on whole 30, because generally so many of the off-limits items are hidden in food that you wouldn't expect it to be (e.g., sugar added to your mustard).  So, that being said...

I met a colleague for dinner tonight and we couldn't have been more delighted with our food at the service. I was able to order the seared duck breast, which is grilled simply with olive oil salt and pepper. You wouldn't believe how flavorful it was. The waiter recommended a market fresh salad as a better fit than what was listed on the menu (the fig and chicory salad that was listed had a dressing with an off limit ingredient). They put together a fruit plate for me for dessert, and I kid you not the plums and peaches were the best I have ever had. Go here! Go here! Go here! Ten stars if I could give them.
author: Briana G.

description:
My future hubby and I came here with another couple to taste out their food and to check out the place - planning on renting out a private area for our upcoming wedding reception and we all agreed, this place is it! The dining experience we had here was fantastic! The dishes we ordered were delicious (besides the pork chop) and service was great, much better than the service we received at Gary Danko... Only complaints - hostess could have done a little more smiling and a little better communication when we asked for help. And it was a bit dim inside, found several people pulling out their phones to use the flashlight. 

Parking might be an issue especially during the day, but they do have valet parking for $10. Much better than the $5/15mins - $33 all day parking lot across the street from them.
author: Flo F.

description:
UPDATE: I finally made it here for a "normal" dinner (see below for my review of their special Passover dinner).

I came for a work dinner in a group of 7. Service was alright; the waiter was oddly hover-y when we sat down and were clearly in the middle of a discussion and thus not ready to order, but hard to get ahold of later in the evening when we needed him. Nice guy overall though.

Anyway, we shared a bunch of appetizers:

- PESCE CRUDO: Fantastic. Highly recommended.
- BURRATA: Very good!
- LITTLE GEMS SALAD (endive and pears): Good, but not as memorable as the others.
- STONE FRUIT, TOMATO, AND PARMASEAN SALAD: Great combination! 
- BEETS WITH YOGURT: beautiful and yummy. 

For my main course, I got two "half size" pastas - I love that you can order half a portion! In theory it's so you can get one as an appetizer, but it's also great if you want a lighter meal... Or want to try more than one pasta! I got the:

- RAVIORA filled with ricotta and lemon, and served in a truffle sauce: AMAZING. Wow. Definitely some of the best pasta I've ever had!
- PAPPARDELLE with braised short rib ragu - Also very good, but not as good as the raviora. 

All their desserts sound amazing, but after consulting with our waiter, I settled on the LAVENDER BAR, which was delicious. It's basically a small layered mousse/cake that's covered in chocolate, and served cut in half on its side. It was a perfect way to end the night!

(Below: Passover 2016 review)
--------

Came here for the Italian Passover special menu last week (see photo), which was a lot of fun. I loved how they had specialty Passover-themed cocktails (which didn't taste all that special/unique, but it's such a great concept).

The food itself ranged from hits to misses, but overall was good. I loved the charoset that they served with matza when we sat down - lots of dates, very Sephardic. The antipasti and the soups were also delicious, particularly the chopped duck liver (amazing), the sweet and sour eggplant (couldn't get enough), and the chicken dumping soup, which looked like matza ball soup but actually had chicken and apple meatballs (delicious - might have to copy this for our own Passover next year...).

However, the main dishes were totally unmemorable, and the side of broccoli rabe, well, let's just say they took the idea of having bitter herbs at Passover much too seriously. The dessert was good, but super small. Also, I didn't appreciate that our waitress had no idea how to pronounce many of the dishes. I get that this was a special, two day only menu, but it really detracted from the experience, and made it seem much less authentic.

Overall, though, we enjoyed the night, and I love that they went out of their way to create such a special and unique (in San Francisco) menu to celebrate Passover. It was a lot of fun.
author: Liz F.

description: I had an amazing experience at Perbacco. It's been hyped up for me (and I've been to its sister restaurant Barbacco), but it totally lived up to expectations. I was with a group of six and everyone enjoyed the food and service tremendously. We had a couple of appetizers between us, including the octopus, which was perfectly cooked (i.e. not rubbery at all); the burrata, which was perfectly creamy and paired with delightful asparagus; and a beet salad, which was tasty. To drink, I started with the Aloe and Goodbye cocktail, an unusual combination that felt like a risky order, but turned out to be nicely refreshing. And for my main, I split the Raviora and the Quail with my SO - the raviora is a MUST. Meyer lemon + ricotta cheese and mint is an incredible combination. The quail is no slouch either, with a crispy exterior, delicate interior, and perfectly paired mushrooms on the side. Suffice it to say, I will be back.
author: Megan B.

description: Love the atmosphere and the service. Sat next to a guy who was being a total Dick, manager and waitress handled him brilliantly. You have to get the tagliatelle pasta. Best. Ever.
author: Eric C.

description: Excellent service! Good selection of vegetarian options. I enjoyed the fresh pasta with a lemon butter sauce and a salad for an impromptu Valentine's day celebration. I loved not being restricted to a prix fix! Prix fix menus can be fun, but not typically for vegetarians, so I was happy to have all of the options on the menu to pick from. They were so thoughtful and made a small to-go bag of 2 beautiful chocolates. I've since returned a few times! A++ staff.
author: Chris P.

description:
It pains me to do this but this most recent experience was pretty awful (April 2016 saturday)

The downstairs seating against the mirror (on the right if you're walking in) was extremely hot and loud. It was so bad you can't hear the person across of you. And you walk out with more of a headache than if you were at a bar. Their air conditioner was broken on another visit but they didn't say anything was wrong today. So maybe they were just saving money and leaving customers to sweat. 

The coujette (small $15) was with asparagus, green garlic and mushrooms. I have had their gnocchi before and it has been really good. But this dish tasted like asparagus baby food. It was one note and the texture was mushy. The mushrooms tasted like asparagus baby food. Even the fresh asparagus tasted like baby food because it was covered in that mushy sauce. So sad to see such awful food come out of what used to be a great kitchen. 

The Tajarine (large $21) looked good but has no flavor this time. I have had this dish multiple times before and it has been amazing. I have had a bad Tajarine before as well but thought maybe that was a fluke. Now I'm wondering if this is the norm. The noodles were still cooked well but the sauce was like eating a meaty pile of no flavor 

Service was slow. I had my utensils in the side and asked our server to get the dish to go but he ignored is for over 10 minutes. Just because we had a lot of bad food on the table didn't mean we wanted to watch it. And if he were observant I would have thought he would have asked is everything ok. Likely I would have said sure. But he didn't even care to ask. 

I'll probably give them another shot but maybe on Saturdays they don't cook as well as other days. Or they assume we don't care how good the experience is because they are busy enough. If that's the case then they should just tell us not to come on Saturdays.  So sad.
author: Traci H.

description:
Lunch review. 

Foccacia, crackers, dip - 4/5
Vitello tonnato - 4/5
Agnolotti dal plin - 4/5 - 7x7
Plin al brasato - 5/5

Overall, short rib ravioli was great. "As good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description: Enjoy eating here, but was disappointed in the Pappardelle pasta. The pasta itself was very good and cooked to perfection. The sauce was disappointing, lacking in flavor, and dry. The gnocchi was very good and I would go back just for that. The noise level is very high, hard to hear the person you are with. The staff is very friendly and helpful.
author: Adia L.

description: We had our anniversary dinner here this past Friday evening.  We started off with the Fritto Misto, dry prosecco for me, Gavi for my husband, and it was the perfect beginning.  We had already been out for a wine and cheese pairing before dinner so went on to the entrée sized pastas.  He had the tajarin with the smoky ragout and I had the duck salciccia pasta with an AMAZING huckleberry and chicken liver sauce.  That may very well have been the best thing I've eaten in a long, long time.  The sommelier (Mark) helped us choose the perfect wine to have with our pasta selections.  We finished up with gelato, and also some lemon hazelnut cookies were presented to us.  Service was impeccable, our waiter Brendan was fantastic, and since we had noted it was our anniversary we were presented with a card and everyone wished us a happy anniversary as well.  My husband has been dining here for years for lunch, and now I made him promise that any time we are both in the city together we can eat here.
author: Erika K.

description: Wonderful food but the atmosphere is a a bit squishy and loud. The quality of pastas is outstanding, but the bread was disappointedly cold upon arrival
author: Daniel W.

description: Came here for dinner after getting married at SF City Hall. It was unplanned and we had no idea what to expect. We started off with the burrata and with a thinly sliced veal dish I can't remember the name of. The burrata was topped with a fresh truffle sauce of sorts and was paired with squash and endive. Sounded strange but the combination of the ingredients created the perfect bite. My husband and I loved it. The veal dish was pretty tasty but not memorable. I ordered the duck pasta and my husband had the butternut squash gnocchi. I thought the pasta was beautifully made on mine, but it was definitely too salty and it was a lot to handle. I still liked it though, it just didn't blow my mind. The gnocchi on the other hand, was the best I've ever had. Absolutely delicious. My husband enjoyed his drink as well as his wine that the server suggested. I missed out as I am pregnant but I took his word for it haha. I didn't really think our server was the friendliest, but it seemed other ones were really nice, as well as the host.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Overall, I thought it was a decent place but, the food definitely wasn't worth the price.

Pros:
- They had a fair amount of vegetarian entrees which is great (sometimes hard to find in higher-end restaurants).
- A fan of the ambience. The place was lively (visited at lunchtime on a weekday), but each of the tables were a bit secluded from each other, so it offered a good deal of privacy. 

Cons:
- Ordered their tomato basil gnocchi entree. To be honest it was very average. I've heard the Plin Al Funghi is better, so perhaps a bad selection on my bad part.
author: Abhi M.

description:
My husband and I had our post SF City Hall Wedding lunch at Perbacco. We had 17 guests and reserved the Barolo Room. We were very happy with the food and service we received and would not have changed anything! 
Reserving the room through the manager was very easy and they were clear with the menu and  costs. Our waitress and other wait staff were all very friendly and attentive to our party. Our food was also great! We offered:

- Burrata Cheese (the appetizer, this was a delicious beet salad filled with rich cheese)
- Agnolotti del plin (so rich and great flavors, I am not a big pasta person but really enjoyed this dish)
- Fish of the day (sole, generous portion served with a beautiful sauce)
- Gnocchi ( I did not try this but other guests loved it)

Definitely recommend Perbacco for a large party or if you have guests not into ethnic food :)
author: Rachael F.

description: The texture and bite of their pasta is perfect. Not overdone, like other in house pasta places I've been to. Pappardelle with short rib ragu was cozy and warm, reminiscent of comfort food. Langaroli was delicious, with a quail jus to die for. Will definitely be back!
author: Gloria S.

description:
Really great little Italian restaurant. Service and ambiance were great for a business meeting, date, or night out with friends. They have a pretty extensive wine list that is reasonably priced and that pairs well with the menu. 

Started with the cannellini bean minestra, which is basically pasta fagioli. It was great. 

For the main course I went with the pappardelle with short rib ragu. This meal was so good  I will not be trying anything else when I go back.
author: Noah D.

description:
Team Dinner for 12 was a success.  They've got a great staff and our party was seated upstairs.  For a little less than $100, we all left stuffed and full of wine.  I was lucky enough to try a bit of all these pieces.  The soup and the seafood entrees seemed to the best of everything.

apps... [* * *]
PESCE CRUDO - yellowfin tuna / crushed avocado / hearts of palm / grapefruit / watermelon radish
FRITTO MISTO - shrimp / seasonal beans / piquillo pepper / olives / fennel / lemon aioli 
HOUSE CURED CINTA SENESE COPPA - apple and celery salad / pickled chanterelles / toasted walnut
BURRATA - roasted butternut squash / kale pesto / pomegranate / toasted pumpkin seed

soup... [* * * * *]
VELLUTATA DI PORCINI - porcini mushroom cream / black truffle mascarpone / chives

pasta...[* * * *]
PAPPARDELLE - wide pasta ribbons / slow cooked short rib ragu / grated horseradish

entrée...[* * * * *]
BLACK SEA BASS "ALLA PIASTRA" - corona bean ragu / roasted artichoke heart / last of season tomato cruda
SEARED SEA SCALLOPS - matsutake mushroom and apple brodetto / chrysanthemum / douglas fir butter

sides...[* * *]
ROASTED BUTTERNUT SQUASH - almond butter / sage / pomegranate 
BROWN BUTTER BRUSSELS SPROUTS - capers / shallots / parmigiano reggiano
DUCK FAT FINGERLING POTATOES - roasted garlic / rosemary

desserts...[* * * * all were pretty terrific, but a little pricey at $11 per plate]
DARK CHOCOLATE BONET - pinot noir sea salt / concord grape saba / tenbrinkfarms walnuts/ spiced gelato
TORTA DI CAROTE - carrot cake / amaretti / pomegranate / zabaione / tenbrink farms walnuts / spiced gelato
KAFFIR LIME LEAF PANNA COTTA - candied buddah hand / lemon balm / satsuma mandarins / chamomile / poppy seed merengue
MILK CHOCOLATE CREMEUX - sea buckthorn / vanilla crema / caramelized rye berry-cocoa nib crumble
BURNT CARAMEL GELATO - tahitian vanilla sea salt / pignoli cookie
author: Patricia N.

description:
Good wine menu. Plenty of options of CA wines and Italians. 
Nice ambiance. The restaurant is pretty formal and it is not so loud which was so pleasant to have wind and dine. However the food is just so-so food. 

We walked-in on Friday night to the sister Restaurant next door (Barbacco) which was sold out for the evening and were  referred to Parbacco. So I wished we got to try the sister Restaurant that was booked up.
author: Maria M.

description: We went here on a business trip and the food and service was A+.  When we inquired about the wine list a sommelier came to our table to answer any questions we had.  The food was excellent and our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive.  Our waters were filled the throughout the meal without ever having to ask.  I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in San Fran
author: Gabrielle W.

description: Came here for our anniversary and they made us feel special.  When we arrived the hostess wished us a happy anniversary and gave us a card.  The waiter greeted us with happy anniversary.  The cocktails were interesting and good.  The food was very good.  We started with the summer peppers and marinated strawberries, both were very good.  We then shared the Raviora - pasta filled with truffle ricotta.  Then we shared the beef cheek, this was also good.  Service very friendly and attentive.  Nice surroundings.  When we left the hostess again wished us a happy anniversary.
author: David F.

description:
Decent service , good ambience .. I had the ricotta cheese tarragon ravioli and it was good .
Nothing mind boggling but very good , yes it is pricey and yes it is
author: Feedback M.

description:
I visited Perbacco when a work event was scheduled here.  The restaurant has a nice ambiance.  Parking is terrible in the area so the restaurant does offer valet at a price.  

Service was on point and extremely attentive.  As for food, I started off with the little gem lettuce salad.  Nothing spectacular but I do love anchovies on my greens.

For the pasta dish, I tried the raviora.  This was absolutely delish.  The pasta was filled with butternut squash and topped with fried sage.  All the pasta dishes are made in house which is always such a treat!  

For the main course, I had the short ribs.  Super tender...definitely lots of time and care went into this dish although the flavors were a little bland to me.  

Wine selection was fantastic.  I'd revisit this spot again for the pasta.
author: Jen W.

description:
I don't know what happened with Perbacco over the years but I had such a disappointing experience there last night it saddens me to reflect on it. It was also embarrassing, as my colleagues from SoCal had relied on me to select a spot for our work dinner as the one who has lived in SF.

Suggested Perbacco since it was close to the office we were working out of. Booking for a table of 12 was more of a headache than we thought it would be which already left a bad taste in our mouths. First they were pushy about us booking the private room; when we requested the main dining room they made it seem like it would be a huge ordeal...finally the manager relented and said we could have a 6pm reservation but asked us to come 15 min early, then at 6pm on the dot started calling for status updates (we arrived at 6:02pm). I'm sorry, it's Wednesday, early, and you are not the hottest restaurant in SF, you just happened to be convenient location-wise.

The meal was decent, not amazing by any means given the plethora of incredible Italian places in the SF area (desserts were probably the highlight). Reasonably-priced when all was said and done (for the large group that we were). But the service...it wasn't horrible it was just straight BIZARRE.

Felt amateur for what you'd expect. Super disjointed...our server didn't seem to be able to multi-task. She would literally recoil as a sommelier was pouring our wine, as if she couldn't continue rattling off her spiel while we were being poured ("Maybe it's an internal house rule?" we wondered.) I was offered a taste by someone else from a bottle I ordered- every other glass was filled but he didn't finish pouring mine after the taste so I had to chase someone down to finish. Several clients we were entertaining had empty glasses and I had to flag someone down to get our server to offer another round. (In a corporate dinner like that, should be easy money just to keep those drinks flowing). When our server caught wind of our anxiousness, was passive aggressive to me with her disdain: "Is there ANYTHING else I can get you? Are you sure?" smiling through gritted teeth then continuously refilled my glass of wine (2 refills within 5 minutes) even though I was slowly sipping.

Afterwards I felt everyone was underwhelmed and just not blown away by any means by the ambiance, the service, the food. 2 stars at best. (Barbacco has a better vibe. Then again that was years ago so who knows.)
author: Jen E.

description:
Came in here for lunch yesterday with a few coworkers and my bosses.
We were seated immediately in the upstairs section, but the restaurant was actually pretty packed.
We started off with the Pesce Crudo and Fritto Misto for appetizers.
I'm not a fan of cucumber or radish, but I was able to eat the Pesce Crudo without any issues, it was good, but I would prefer a tuna tartar.
The Fritto Misto is pretty much battered deep fried veggies and a few shrimp with a side of mayo. It's actually pretty simple, but made for a good appetizer. It didn't seem like many of us like olives, but I love them!
For my main, I got the Piastra Roasted Chicken Breast, which I have ordered once before. I guess I wasn't feeling adventurous yesterday, but I ordered this dish because I had a good experience with it a few years ago.
My coworkers and bosses got the Subrich (meatballs), and Semolina Dusted Petrale Sole. 
I didn't get a taste of their meals, but they seemed to enjoy it.
As for my chicken, it was cooked perfectly! It had the right amount of crisp on the skin, it wasn't dry, and the green garlic-herb jus made a perfect light sauce. Portions of my chicken I felt was a bit small, but with the appetizers I felt I had the right amount of food.
We went to order a few desserts for the table; the Malted Dark Chocolate Ganache and the Stonefruit Gelato.
Although I liked the texture of the chocolate, I don't think I would get it again. The big piece in the center looked more like a milk chocolate (which is what I prefer), but had the taste of dark chocolate. Sorry, I'm just not a dark chocolate person.
The Stonefruit Gelato was absolutely amazing! It's extremely hard for me to describe this one as I haven't had a gelato like this before. You'll just have to give it a try!
Overall service wasn't terrible, but there was a lot of waiting in between orders. We intended to finish within an 1hr15mins, but from entering the door and leaving, it took about 1hr45mins.
This probably isn't somewhere I would come by myself, but it makes for a nice business lunch/dinner spot, or somewhere to take a date.
If you're looking for something more casual, go next door to Barbacco, Perbacco's sister restaurant.
author: Mike O.

description:
Ok this restaurant has some of the best Italian dishes from this side of the Atlantic ocean. However, the desert was just such a turn off. It is so unsavory to the point if we ever decide to go back (desert is pretty important to cap off a great meal). we might need to go to another restaurant afterwards for that purpose!

I wish I can give this restaurant a 3 and 1/2 stars because there were so many high moments throughout our Anniversary meal:

*The pasta dishes and the slow cooked short ribs were fantastic
*Ambience is a bit on the conservative side
*Price is really great for the quality & portion of the food served
*Our server tried really hard although he was a bit of stiff and stern
*And the dreadful desert left us looking for another desert spot 

Just to clarify, the deserts were bland tasting and had a card board texture. We are so torn because we loved the main courses so much but we are so unsure whether we would revisit this restaurant due to the things I've shared above :-(
author: kathy w.

description: Ridiculously mean, rude, arrogant VALET PERSONNEL!! The attitude is very unpleasant, a lot of cursing going on.
author: Andrey S.
